intro: Urostigma stipulosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved urostigma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are narrow and have a distinctive stipule structure, giving it its scientific name. Urostigma stipulosum produces small, greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family.
